intro: Vincetoxicum alabamense, commonly known as Alabama snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Vincetoxicum alabamense is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is considered a perennial herb.
